title: Firefox Sidebar Migration Chrome Compatibility
content:
CRITICAL FINDING: Chrome does NOT support sidebar_action API - this is Firefox-exclusive.

Implementation Strategy:
- Firefox: Added sidebar_action to manifest.json with settings.html as default_panel
- Firefox: Removed default_popup from browser_action so toolbar button opens sidebar
- Chrome: Keeps default_popup in manifest.chrome.json for backward compatibility
- Cross-browser detection: background.js checks for browser.sidebarAction before registering handler

Manifest Changes:
1. Added sidebar_action with default_panel: "sidebar/settings.html"
2. Removed default_popup from browser_action in Firefox manifest
3. Added _execute_sidebar_action command with Ctrl+Shift+S shortcut
4. Chrome manifest.chrome.json remains unchanged (keeps popup.html)

Background.js Handler:
- Added feature detection: if (browser.sidebarAction) then register onClicked handler
- Firefox: toolbar button calls browser.sidebarAction.open()
- Chrome: toolbar button shows popup.html (existing behavior preserved)

Files Created:
- sidebar/settings.html: Unified interface with tab navigation between Settings and Quick Tabs
- sidebar/settings.js: Converted from options_page.js, preserves all storage logic
- sidebar/settings.css: Sidebar-optimized responsive design with dark mode support
